subject: Real Estate
title: Adaptive Reuse: Old Buildings, New Lives
description: A short lesson to help you apply Adaptive Reuse: Old Buildings, New Lives.

hook.text: A former factory becomes luxury lofts. An old church becomes a restaurant. A bank vault becomes a speakeasy.

buildup.text: Adaptive reuse converts obsolete buildings into new uses, preserving character while meeting modern needs.

discovery.text: Reuse is often cheaper and faster than new construction, and it keeps embodied carbon out of landfills.

twist.text: Post-pandemic, thousands of empty office towers are being studied for residential conversion.

climax.text: Adaptive reuse turns liabilities into assets. The best building to construct is often one that already exists.

punchline.text: The greenest building is the one already standing.

quiz.question: Why is adaptive reuse considered environmentally friendly?
options: It preserves embodied carbon and reduces waste
